meanings.definition: Canonizers (noun): Those who establish or uphold a set of rules or principles.
meanings.sent1: The canonizers in our group always make sure we follow the rules.
meanings.sent2: The canonizers of the book club decided on the reading list for the month.
meanings.sent3: The canonizers at the library made a rule that all books must be returned on time.
meanings.sent4: She was like a canonizer of fashion, setting strict rules for what was acceptable to wear.
meanings.sent5: The strict canonizers of the school's code of conduct ensured everyone followed the rules.

meanings.definition: Canonizers (verb): To officially recognize or accept something as authoritative or valid.
meanings.sent1: The committee will canonize the new policy after thorough review.
meanings.sent2: The council decided to canonize the historical document as an important artifact.
meanings.sent3: The town decided to canonize the annual festival as a tradition to be upheld.
meanings.sent4: Her words were canonized by the community as the ultimate truth.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's groundbreaking research was quickly canonized by the scientific community.
